fullDescription.intro: This layer works similarly to a convolution layer, except that weights are unshared, that is, a different set of filters is applied at each different patch of the input. Corresponds to the Keras Locally Connected 1D Layer.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: The name prefix of the layer. The prefix is complemented by an index suffix to obtain a unique layer name. If this option is unchecked, the name prefix is derived from the layer type.
The dimensionality of the output space (i.e. the number of output filters in the convolution).
The length of the 1D convolution window.
The stride length of the convolution. Specifying any stride value != 1 is incompatible with specifying any dilation_rate value != 1.
Locally Connected Layers only support 'valid' padding.
If checked, a bias vector will be used.
Initializer for the kernel weights matrix.
Regularizer function applied to the kernel weights matrix.
Regularizer function applied to the bias vector.
Regularizer function applied to the output of the layer (its "activation").
Constraint function applied to the kernel matrix.
Constraint function applied to the bias vector.

ports.inPort: The Keras deep learning network to which to add a Locally Connected 1D layer.
ports.outPort: The Keras deep learning network with an added Locally Connected 1D layer.
